PharosPHP::Core::Classes::Exceptions Namespace Reference

Detailed Description

CachedFileExpiredException Raised when using the Cache and the resource has expired

Author:
Matt Brewer

CacheNotEnabledException Raised when using the Cache and it is not enabled

Author:
Matt Brewer

CacheNotWritableException Raised when using the Cache and it is not writable

Author:
Matt Brewer

ClassNotFoundException Raised when attempting to load a class, and it cannot be found IE, Loader::load_class("BOB");

Author:
Matt Brewer

ControllerActionNotFoundException Raised in the default implementation of the Controller->__missingControllerAction() so the system has a chance to display a 404 page. Overriding Controller->__missingControllerAction() so that it does not throw a ControllerActionNotFoundException will eliminate the automatic 404 page generation

Author:
Matt Brewer

FTPClientConnectionException Raised when the FTPClient encounters an unknown error establishing a connection

Author:
Matt Brewer

FTPClientInvalidConnectionSettingsException Raised when invalid connection settings are provided to the FTPClient

Author:
Matt Brewer

FTPClientLoginFailureException Raised when there is a failure logging in with the FTPClient

Author:
Matt Brewer

FTPClientMultipleConnectCallsException Raised when asking the FTPClient to make a connection, when the client has already connected to the specified host

Author:
Matt Brewer

FTPClientNotConnectedException Raised when using the FTPClient class and the client has not established a connection

Author:
Matt Brewer

InvalidFileSystemPathException

Author:
Matt Brewer

InvalidHookException Raised when using the Hooks API and providing an invalid hook name (one that has not been registered)

Author:
Matt Brewer

InvalidKeyPathException Raised when attempting to create a key path in an invalid format

Author:
Matt Brewer

PharosBaseException Provides basic exception additions that all built-in exceptions make use of

Author:
Matt Brewer

ReadOnlyPropertyException Raised when code attempts to access protected or private instance vars not protected by the language IE, when the class implements magic __set() & __get() methods giving the user exposure to internal workings.

Author:
Matt Brewer
